intro: Lavoisiera alba var. longifolia, commonly known as the white lavoisiera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its white, showy flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
